The standard conversion from L-407 to A-419 involves substituting the L (which is leucine) to alanine. So looking at the DNA sequence: L-407 is positions 4,5,6 being L-407, so the first codon is G, C, H in DNA, which corresponds to L-407. To get to alanine, which is A-419, the DNA codon would be A, T, C. So that requires changing G-C-H to A-T-C. So that's three substitutions: G→A, C→T, H→C. Therefore, three substitutions.
